name: superabundance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a very large amount of something, especially more than is needed or usual: The country has a superabundance of natural resources. See
superabundant
More examplesFewer examplesCursed as I am with a superabundance of self-consciousness, I spend a lot of time loathing my own inability to do anything useful.It is 4 ft. by 6 ft. and 3 ft. high, so you can understand that there's not a superabundance of space.The increase in the cost of houses is the result of a superabundance of money facing a shortage of building land.Less eye-catching, but still in superabundance, are the black berries of ivy and blue-black sloes.
